Pillarbeh_1. I usually behave in a considerate manner in public settings
Pillarbeh_2. I regularly help / look out for my close friends and family
Pillarbeh_3. I regularly help / look out for my wider network (e.g. colleagues, neighbours, etc.)
Pillarbeh_4. I regularly donate to causes or people in need (monetary, clothes, food, giving blood, etc.)
Pillarbeh_5. I regularly volunteer for causes or people in need
Pillarbeh_6. I offer help to others without being asked
Pillarbeh_7. I make an effort to give constructive feedback on national policies and issues
Pillarbeh_8. I lead and/or mobilise others for causes and issues that matter to me
Pillarbeh_9. I regularly take part in community initiatives or grassroots activities
Pillarbeh_10. I make a conscious effort to get along with people from different cultures or nationalities
Pillarbeh_11. I make an effort not to start or add to racially-sensitive situations or conversations
Pillarbeh_12. I make an effort to ease racially-sensitive situations when they happen
Pillarbeh_13. I make an active effort to include people from different cultures or nationalities in my daily life
Pillarbeh_14. I proactively make efforts to understand the practices of different cultures (e.g. learning more, attending festivities, etc.)
Pillarbeh_15. I have good friends from different cultures or nationalities
Pillarvals_1. It is important for me to act in a way that is consistent with the values of society
Pillarvals_2. I am strongly guided by the desire to do the right thing
Pillarvals_3. It is important to me that my actions are consistent with the actions of those around me
Pillarvals_4. I am willing to act in a way that benefits others even if it costs me (e.g. in time, money, effort)
Pillarvals_5. I believe it is my responsibility or duty to contribute to society
Pillarvals_6. Offering help to others (including donating and volunteering) are things I do to increase my well-being
Pillarvals_7. I offer to help others even if it risks offending someone
Pillarvals_8. I know how to help people in need (e.g. who needs help, what help is needed, and how to help, etc.)
Pillarvals_9. I want to have a say in the decisions and policies that affect my life
Pillarvals_12. In Singapore, citizens are often encouraged to play an active role in society and have the means to do so
Pillarvals_13. I feel I can create positive change in my life and in my community
Pillarvals_14. I feel that I belong and am accepted in Singapore
Pillarvals_21. I believe that I have things in common with people of different cultures and nationalities
Pillarvals_22. I feel that being able to interact well with people of different cultures and nationalities is beneficial to me
Pillarvals_23. There are enough opportunities for meaningful interactions with people of different cultures
Pillarvals_24. There are enough opportunities for meaningful interactions with people of different nationalities
Pillarvals_25. People around me generally respect differences in culture, lifestyle and beliefs
Pillarvals_26. It is wrong to make racially or culturally insensitive remarks
Pillarvals_29. I am confident that Singapore has a bright future ahead
Pillarvals_30. I am willing to support Singapore in both good and bad times
Pillarvals_31. There are enough opportunities in Singapore for me to achieve my personal aspirations in life
Pillarvals_32. There are enough opportunities in Singapore for me to live by my values
Pillarvals_33. I am committed to staying in Singapore in the long-run
